name: aws-commands
label: AWS Commands
description: AWS Commands are used to run AWS native commands for AWS resources configurations directly from FortiSOAR.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.description: Select configuration type that is how you want to provide credentials.

IAM Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role
IAM Role.name: aws_iam_role
IAM Role.tooltip: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.
IAM Role.description: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Region
Access Credentials.name: aws_region
Access Credentials.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
Access Credentials.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Access Key ID
Access Credentials.name: aws_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services.
Access Credentials.description: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Secret Access Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_secret_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.
Access Credentials.description: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.

operations.title: Execute AWS Command
operations.description: Executes an AWS command on the host based on the command and other input parameters that you have specified.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.name: command
parameters.title: Command
parameters.tooltip: Specify the AWS command, without the aws, to run on the host. For example, if you want to run the command aws ec2 describe-instances to list all EC2 instances, Specify ec2 describe-instances in this field.
parameters.description: Specify the AWS command, without the aws, to run on the host. For example, if you want to run the command aws ec2 describe-instances to list all EC2 instances, Specify ec2 describe-instances in this field.

parameters.name: optional_parameters
parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.placeholder: --instance-ids i-1234515  (parameters is a space sperated list of arguments, so parameters do not need to be quoted.)
parameters.tooltip: Specify a parameter name and its value to filter the results returned by the command. For information on parameters, refer https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/#latest-version
parameters.description: Specify a parameter name and its value to filter the results returned by the command. For information on parameters, refer https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/#latest-version

operations.title: Get AMIs Detail
operations.description: Retrieves details for all AMIs (Amazon Machine Images) or specific AMIs, based on input parameters you have specified from AWS.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services. Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Image IDs
parameters.name: image_ids
parameters.tooltip: List of IDs of the AMIs whose details you want to retrieve from AWS Commands.
parameters.description: List of IDs of the AMIs whose details you want to retrieve from AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Executable Users
parameters.name: executable_users
parameters.tooltip: List of AWS Account IDs of executable users(s) associated with the AMI(s) whose details you want to retrieve from AWS Commands.
parameters.description: List of AWS Account IDs of executable users(s) associated with the AMI(s) whose details you want to retrieve from AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Owners
parameters.name: owners
parameters.tooltip: List of AWS Account IDs of owners associated with the AMI(s) whose details you want to retrieve from AWS Commands..
parameters.description: List of AWS Account IDs of owners associated with the AMI(s) whose details you want to retrieve from AWS Commands..

parameters.title: Filters
parameters.name: filters
parameters.tooltip: List of filters(Name and Values Pairs) based on which you want to retrieve details of AMIs from AWS Commands.
parameters.description: List of filters based on which you want to retrieve details of AMIs from AWS Commands.

operations.title: Launch Instance
operations.description: Launches a new instance on AWS having basic configuration based on the image ID, instance type, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services. Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Image ID
parameters.name: image_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the AMI on which you want to launch a new instance. You can get the ID of an AMI using the Get AMIs Detail operation.
parameters.description: ID of the AMI on which you want to launch a new instance. You can get the ID of an AMI using the Get AMIs Detail operation.

parameters.title: Instance Type
parameters.name: instance_type
parameters.tooltip: Type of the instance that you want to launch on AWS Commands. For example, t1.micro
parameters.description: Type of the instance that you want to launch on AWS Commands. For example, t1.micro

parameters.title: Instance MaxCount
parameters.name: maxcount
parameters.tooltip: If you specify a maximum that is greater than the maximum number of instances Amazon EC2 can launch in the target Availability Zone, Amazon EC2 launches the largest possible number of instances above MinCount.
parameters.description: Maximum number of instances to launch on AWS Commands. If you specify a maximum that is greater than the maximum number of instances Amazon EC2 can launch in the target Availability Zone, Amazon EC2 launches the largest possible number of instances above MinCount.

parameters.title: Instance MinCount
parameters.name: mincount
parameters.tooltip: If you specify a minimum that is lesser than the minimum number of instances than Amazon EC2 can launch in the target Availability Zone, Amazon EC2 launches no instances.
parameters.description: Minimum number of instances to launch on AWS Commands. If you specify a minimum that is lesser than the minimum number of instances than Amazon EC2 can launch in the target Availability Zone, Amazon EC2 launches no instances.

parameters.title: SubNet ID
parameters.name: subnetid
parameters.tooltip: ID of the subnet associated with the network string. ID of a subnet must be provided if you don't want to use default subnet to this instance
parameters.description: ID of the subnet associated with the network string.ID of a subnet must be provided if you don't want to use default subnet to this instance

parameters.title: Device Name
parameters.name: device_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the device. For example, /dev/sdh or xvdh.
parameters.description: Name of the device. For example, /dev/sdh or xvdh.

parameters.title: Instance Delete on Termination
parameters.name: delete_on_termination
parameters.tooltip: Indicates whether the EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.
parameters.description: Select this option if you want to delete the interface when the instance is terminated.

parameters.title: Security Group IDs
parameters.name: security_groups_list
parameters.tooltip: One or more security group IDs. Default: Amazon EC2 uses the default security group. You can give multiple group ids like "sg-3578605d", "sg-f1445c99" or ['sg-3578605d', 'sg-f1445c99']
parameters.description: SD(s) of the security group(s) to be assigned to the newly launched instance on AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Purpose For Launch Instance
parameters.name: purpose
parameters.tooltip: Purpose of launching the instance on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: Purpose of launching the instance on AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Customer Name
parameters.name: customer_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the customer for whom you are requesting the launch of the new instance on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: Name of the customer for whom you are requesting the launch of the new instance on AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Terminate by Date
parameters.name: terminate_by_date
parameters.tooltip: Date on which the instance will be terminated on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: Date on which the instance will be terminated on AWS Commands.

operations.title: Get Instance Details
operations.description: Retrieves details for an instance you have specified, using the instance ID from AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services. Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Instance ID
parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the instance for which you want to retrieve details from AWS Commands.
parameters.description: ID of the instance for which you want to retrieve details from AWS Commands.

operations.title: Register Instance To ELB
operations.description: Registers an AWS Commands instance to the elastic load balancing (ELB) service on AWS based on the ELB name and instance ID you have specified

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services. Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: ELB Name
parameters.name: elb_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the ELB to which you want to register the specified instance on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: Name of the ELB to which you want to register the specified instance on AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Instance ID
parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the instance that you want to register with the specified ELB on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: ID of the instance that you want to register with the specified ELB on AWS Commands.

operations.title: Deregister Instance from ELB
operations.description: Deregisters an instance from the elastic load balancing (ELB) service based on the ELB name and instance ID you have specified.

operations.title: Attach Instance To Auto Scaling Group
operations.description: Attaches a running instance to the auto scaling group on AWS Commands based on the auto scaling group name and instance ID (s) you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services. Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN

true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Auto Scaling Group Name
parameters.name: autoscaling_group_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the auto scaling group to which you want to attach the specified instance on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: Name of the auto scaling group to which you want to attach the specified instance on AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Instance IDs (In CSV or List Format)
parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.tooltip: One or more security group IDs. You can give multiple group ids like 'i-000a15c1589bb38ec', 'i-0055c209fce039354' or ['i-000a15c1589bb38ec', 'i-0055c209fce039354']
parameters.description: ID(s) of the instance(s) that you want to attach to the specified auto scaling group using the CSV or list format on AWS Commands.

operations.title: Detach Instance From Auto Scaling Group
operations.description: Detaches an EC2 instance from the auto scaling group on AWS Commands based on the auto scaling group name and instance ID (s) you have specified.

parameters.title: Instance IDs
parameters.name: instance_id

operations.title: Attach Volume
operations.description: Attaches a volume to an AWS Commands instance based on the volume ID, Device Name, and instance ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services. Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Volume Id
parameters.name: volume_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the volume that you want to attach to the specified instance on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: ID of the volume that you want to attach to the specified instance on AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Device Name
parameters.name: device_name
parameters.description: Name (or full path) of the device on the specified instance on AWS Commands. For example, /dev/sdh or xvdh.
parameters.tooltip: Name (or full path) of the device on the specified instance on AWS Commands. For example, /dev/sdh or xvdh.

parameters.title: Instance Id
parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: ID of the instance to which you want to attach the specified volume on AWS Commands.
parameters.tooltip: ID of the instance to which you want to attach the specified volume on AWS Commands.

operations.title: Add Network ACL Rule
operations.description: Adds a rule to the network access control list (ACL) on AWS Commands based on the network ACL ID, egress rule, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Network ACL ID
parameters.name: network_acl_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the network in which you want to add the ACL rule on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: ID of the network in which you want to add the ACL rule on AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Egress Rule
parameters.name: egress_rule
parameters.tooltip: Select either Inbound_Rule or Outbound_Rule.
parameters.description: Select either Inbound_Rule or Outbound_Rule.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.name: ip_address
parameters.tooltip: IP address of the network in which you want to add the ACL rule on AWS Commands.
parameters.description: IP address of the network in which you want to add the ACL rule on AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Rule Action
parameters.name: rule_action
parameters.tooltip: Action that the rule must perform. Choose between DENY or ALLOW.
parameters.description: Action that the rule must perform. Choose between DENY or ALLOW.

parameters.title: Rule Number
parameters.name: rule_number
parameters.description: Position of where the rule must be placed in the ACL rules on AWS Commands.Constraints: Positive integer from 1 to 32766
parameters.tooltip: Position of where the rule must be placed in the ACL rules on AWS Commands.Constraints: Positive integer from 1 to 32766

validation.patternError: Value must be an integer in range 1 to 32766.

operations.title: Get Details of Network ACLs
operations.description: Retrieves details of one or more of your network ACLs from AWS Commands, based on the Network ACL IDs and filters you have specified. Note: If you do not specify any network ACL ID or any filter, then details of all the network ACLs are retrieved from AWS Commands.

If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services. Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Network ACL IDs
parameters.name: network_acl_ids
parameters.tooltip: IDs of the network in which you want to describe.
parameters.description: IDs of the network ACL whose details you want to retrieve from AWS Commands. Note: If you do not specify and ID then details of all the Network ACLs are retrieved from AWS Commands.

parameters.title: Filters
parameters.name: filters
parameters.tooltip: Filters to describe Network ACLs. Format: [{'Name': 'string','Values': ['string']}]
parameters.description: Filters based on which you want to retrieve details for network ACL from AWS Commands. Format of the filter is: [{'Name': 'string','Values': ['string']}] For example, [{'Name': 'vpc-id','Values': ['vpc-a01106c2']}]

parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role.Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services. Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Security Group ID
parameters.name: security_group_id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the security group ID on AWS Commands in which you want to authorize (add) the ingress rule.
parameters.description: ID of the security group ID on AWS Commands in which you want to authorize (add) the ingress rule.

parameters.title: IP Permissions
parameters.name: ip_permissions
parameters.tooltip: IP permissions required to Authorize ingress rules.
parameters.description: IP permissions required to Authorize ingress rules.

operations.title: Authorize Egress
operations.description: Adds (authorizes) egress rules to a security group on AWS Commands based on the security group ID, and IP permissions you have specified.

operations.title: Revoke Egress
operations.description: Removes (revokes) egress rules from a security group on AWS Commands based on the security group ID, and IP permissions you have specified.

operations.title: Revoke Ingress
operations.description: Removes (revokes) ingress rules from a security group on AWS Commands based on the security group ID, CIDR IP value, and other input parameters you have specified.
